TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract StyleSheets implements class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: A collection of objects that represents the cascading style sheets attached to a document.

remarks.para: The StyleSheets collection includes all cascading style sheets displayed in the Linked CSS Style Sheets dialog box, accessed using the Templates and Add-ins command (Tools menu).
Use the property to return the StyleSheets collection. Use the method to add a style sheet to the StyleSheets collection.

Public Function Add (FileName As String, LinkType As WdStyleSheetLinkType, Title As String, Precedence As WdStyleSheetPrecedence) As StyleSheet

public: Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::StyleSheet ^ Add(System::String ^ FileName, Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdStyleSheetLinkType LinkType, System::String ^ Title, Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdStyleSheetPrecedence Precedence);

Docs.param: Required String. The path and file name of the cascading style sheet.
Required . Indicates whether the style sheet should be added as a link or imported into the Web document.Can be one of the following constants: wdStyleSheetLinkTypeImported wdStyleSheetLinkTypeLinked
Required String. The name of the style sheet.

Required . Indicates the level of importance compared to other cascading style sheets attached to the Web document.Can be one of the following constants:wdStyleSheetPrecedenceHigherwdStyleSheetPrecedenceHighestwdStyleSheetPrecedenceLowerwdStyleSheetPrecedenceLowest
Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents a new style sheet added to a Web document.

MemberSignature.Value: public int Creator { get; }
.property instance int32 Creator
Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.
